words.definition: If something is beneficial, it is good for you.
words.example: Drinking milk everyday is beneficial to your bones.

words.definition: A birthplace is a place where a person is born or where something started.
words.example: China is the birthplace of chopsticks.

words.definition: The capacity of something is the amount of things that can be put in it.
words.example: The parking lot has reached its full capacity.

words.definition: If something is comparative, it is being judged based on something else.
words.example: The money that John has is comparative to most other adults.

words.definition: If something is comprehensive, it includes all the necessary facts or details.
words.example: The book provides a comprehensive guide to history.

words.definition: To conserve something is to protect it or use it carefully.
words.example: We should all try to conserve water.

words.definition: If something is crucial, it is extremely important.
words.example: It is crucial that you finish your homework tonight.

words.definition: Cumulative describes an increase by successive additions.
words.example: The cumulative effect of the rain caused the flood.

words.definition: To deposit something is to put it into a place or keep it there.
words.example: He deposited his money into his bank account.

words.definition: To distribute something is to give it to a number of people.
words.example: The charity distributed food to the poor families.

words.definition: The equator is an imaginary line around the middle of the Earth.
words.example: The equator divides the Earth into northern and southern halves.

words.definition: Something exotic is unusual because it comes from a distant country.
words.example: The garden was filled with exotic plants from around the world.

words.definition: Federal relates to a central government of a country.
words.example: The federal government passed a new law about taxes.

words.definition: Formation is the way that something is made or shaped.
words.example: The cloud formation in the sky looked like a dragon.

words.definition: Frequency is the number of times that something happens.
words.example: The frequency of trains on this line is every ten minutes.

words.definition: An objective is a goal that you are working toward.
words.example: Our objective is to finish the project by Friday.

words.definition: Oxygen is a gas that all living things need to breathe.
words.example: Plants produce oxygen for humans and animals.

words.definition: A rainforest is a forest that gets a lot of rain.
words.example: The Amazon is the largest rainforest in the world.

words.definition: A strategy is a plan for how to reach a goal.
words.example: The team came up with a new strategy to win the game.

words.definition: If an area is wooded, it is covered with trees.
words.example: They went for a walk in a wooded area near their home.
